devotionals.books: And behold, a leper came and worshiped Him, saying, â€˜Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.â€™ - Matthew 8:2

devotionals.title: Chosen by Graceâ€”Jesus Calls You As You Are
devotionals.devotionalText:
This verse is a beautiful reminder of how much Jesus loves you and how His grace calls you, no matter where you are. 	And Matthewâ€™s response? Immediate obedience. He didnâ€™t question whether he was worthy; he simply got up and followed Jesus. This is the power of Godâ€™s loveâ€”it calls you, it transforms you, and it leads you into something greater.

	Maybe youâ€™ve wondered if Jesus would really call someone like you. Maybe you feel like youâ€™ve made too many mistakes or that your past disqualifies you. But hereâ€™s the truth: Jesus sees beyond your past and calls you into His future. His grace is greater than your failures, and His love is bigger than your doubts. 	Jesus is still saying,'Follow Me.' Not because youâ€™re perfect, but because His love is perfect. Not because you have it all together, but because His grace is what transforms you.

	Following Jesus doesnâ€™t mean you have to understand everything right away. It simply means trusting Him, taking that first step, and allowing Him to lead you. He has a purpose for your life, just as He had a purpose for Matthew.

	Today, Jesus is calling you to draw closer to Him. Heâ€™s not looking at your flawsâ€”Heâ€™s looking at your heart. Will you say yes?

	Jesus, I thank You that Your love calls me just as I am. I donâ€™t have to be perfectâ€”I just have to say yes. I choose to follow You, to trust You, and to walk in Your grace. I let go of my past, my doubts, and my fears, knowing that Your plans for me are good. Lead me, change me, and use me for Your glory. I am Yours. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: As Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, â€˜Follow Me.â€™ So he arose and followed Him. - Matthew 9:9

devotionals.title: Made New by His Love and Grace

Jesus spoke these words to reveal a powerful truth: His grace doesnâ€™t come to patch up your old lifeâ€”it comes to make you brand new. He wasnâ€™t interested in simply improving the religious traditions of the Pharisees. He came to bring a new covenant, a new way of living, and a new life that is only found in Him.

	The Pharisees were holding on to their old ways, trying to fit Jesus into their traditions and legalistic mindset. 	Jesus isnâ€™t asking you to mix His new life with your old way of thinking. Heâ€™s inviting you to surrender completely, to let go of the past, and to step fully into the grace He has given you. You donâ€™t have to strive, perform, or hold on to what wasâ€”His love has already made you new.

	Jesus, I thank You that Your love doesnâ€™t just improve my lifeâ€”it completely transforms me. devotionals.books: Then He spoke a parable to them: â€˜No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old one; otherwise the new makes a tear, and also the piece that was taken out of the new does not match the old. And no one puts new wine into old wineskins; or else the new wine will burst the wineskins and be spilled, and the wineskins will be ruined.â€™ - Luke 5:36-37

devotionals.title: Set Free by His Loveâ€”Grace That Transforms
devotionals.devotionalText:
This moment in Scripture reveals the depth of Jesusâ€™s love and the power of His grace. The man Jesus spoke to had been sick for thirty-eight years before encountering Him at the pool of Bethesda. With just a few words, Jesus healed him completely. But their story didnâ€™t end there.

	At first glance, this could sound like Jesus was saying, 'Behave, or youâ€™ll lose your healing.' But thatâ€™s not the heart of Jesus. He wasnâ€™t warning out of judgmentâ€”He was loving out of grace.

	Jesus wasnâ€™t just interested in healing his bodyâ€”He wanted to heal his heart. Physical healing is powerful, but spiritual freedom is eternal. Jesusâ€™s words were an invitation, not a condemnation. He was saying, â€œDonâ€™t go back to what kept you bound. I have set you freeâ€”now walk in that freedom.â€

	This is the beauty of His grace. Jesus doesnâ€™t just save you from somethingâ€”He saves you for something greater. He gives you the strength to walk in righteousness, not by your own power, but by His love working within you.

	Maybe there are things in your past that have kept you stuckâ€”patterns, habits, or ways of thinking that try to pull you back into bondage. But Jesusâ€™s love doesnâ€™t just forgive youâ€”it empowers you to live differently. His grace is what enables you to walk in victory.

	You donâ€™t have to be afraid of slipping back into old ways. Jesus is with you, strengthening you, guiding you, and reminding you that you are no longer the person you used to be. You have been made well. You have been set free.

	Today, donâ€™t just receive His graceâ€”walk in it. Let His love transform you from the inside out.

	Jesus, thank You for Your love that not only heals but transforms me. I am not who I used to beâ€”I am made new by Your grace. Help me to walk in the freedom You have given me. Strengthen me against anything that tries to pull me back into my past. I trust You to lead me, and I choose to live in the victory You have won for me. devotionals.books: Afterward, Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, â€˜See, you have been made well. Sin no more, lest a worse thing come upon you.â€™ - John 5:14

devotionals.title: Unshaken by Oppositionâ€”Walking in Grace and Identity
devotionals.devotionalText:
This verse comes after Jesus healed a man who had been sick for thirty-eight years. Instead of celebrating the miracle, the religious leaders were furious. Why? Because Jesus performed the healing on the Sabbath. They were so consumed with rules and traditions that they missed the heart of Godâ€”a heart of love, grace, and restoration.

	But hereâ€™s what stands outâ€”Jesus was not moved by their criticism. He didnâ€™t let their judgment stop Him from fulfilling His purpose. He wasnâ€™t trying to fit into their expectations or gain their approval. He knew who He was, and He walked in the power of that identity.

	And hereâ€™s the powerful truthâ€”you are now in Christ, and His identity has become yours. Just as Jesus was unshaken by opposition, you, too, can walk in boldness, knowing that you are deeply loved, fully accepted, and called by God.

	Maybe youâ€™ve faced resistance for living out your faith. Maybe people have misunderstood you, criticized your journey, or tried to define you by your past. But hereâ€™s what Jesus teaches usâ€”your identity is not found in what others say; it is found in what God has declared over you.

	The enemy would love to make you doubt who you are. He wants you to feel insecure, unworthy, and hesitant in your calling. But Jesusâ€™s love is greater than any accusation. He has covered you in His righteousness, filled you with His grace, and given you the authority to walk confidently in Him.

	Jesus didnâ€™t back down when He was opposed, and neither should you. You donâ€™t have to strive to prove yourselfâ€”you are already approved by God. You donâ€™t have to live for the applause of othersâ€”Jesusâ€™s love is enough.

	Today, choose to stand firm in your identity. Walk boldly in the grace He has given you. No matter who criticizes, doubts, or misunderstands you, rememberâ€”you are His. And that is enough.

	Jesus, I thank You that my identity is found in You alone. I will not be shaken by opposition, fear, or the opinions of others. I am fully loved, fully accepted, and fully covered by Your grace. Help me to walk in confidence, knowing that I am called and chosen for a greater purpose. I will not strive for approval, because I am already approved by You. I stand in my true identity and boldly live out the life You have called me to. Amen!âœï¸
devotionals.books: For this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath. - John 5:16

devotionals.title: Renewed in His Loveâ€”Taking Every Thought Captive
devotionals.devotionalText:
Your mind is a battlefield. Every day, thoughts comeâ€”some filled with faith and truth, and others full of fear, doubt, and insecurity. But hereâ€™s the good news: Jesus has given you the power to take control of your thoughts and renew your mind with His love.

	The enemy loves to plant liesâ€”â€œYouâ€™re not enough,â€ â€œGod is disappointed in you,â€ â€œYouâ€™ll never change,â€ â€œYouâ€™re too broken to be used by God.â€ But those thoughts do not define you. Your true identity is found in Jesus, and His love speaks a greater truth over you.

	When Jesus went to the cross, He didnâ€™t just pay for your sinsâ€”He gave you a brand-new identity. You are no longer who you used to be. You are redeemed, loved, chosen, and victorious. His grace has transformed you from the inside out, and now, He invites you to renew your mind daily with this truth.

	Paul tells us in 2 Corinthians 10:5 that we have the authority to â€œbring every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ.â€ That means you donâ€™t have to accept every thought that enters your mind. You have the power to reject lies and replace them with truth.

	When a thought comes that contradicts Godâ€™s Word, donâ€™t dwell on itâ€”take it captive. Speak the truth over yourself:

	Jesus has made me worthy. I am the righteousness of God in Christ (2 Corinthians 5:21).

	Jesus promised He will never leave me nor forsake me (Hebrews 13:5).

	I am being transformed by the renewing of my mind (Romans 12:2).

	Jesusâ€™s love is your weapon. His grace empowers you to think differently, believe differently, and live differently. You are not a prisoner to negative thoughtsâ€”you are free to walk in His truth.

	Today, make the decision to renew your mind. Fill your heart with His Word, declare His promises, and refuse to let anything steal your identity in Christ. You are His beloved, and nothing can change that.

	Jesus, I thank You that my identity is found in You. I reject every lie that does not align with Your Word, and I choose to renew my mind with Your truth. I take captive every thought that tries to steal my joy, my peace, and my confidence. I declare that I am loved, chosen, and victorious in You. Your grace empowers me to think, speak, and live according to who I truly am in You. I walk in freedom, knowing that I am Yours. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: Casting down arguments and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ. - 2 Corinthians 10:5

devotionals.title: The Freedom of Trusting in Godâ€™s Love
devotionals.devotionalText:
One of the biggest traps in life is living for the approval of others. Itâ€™s easy to fall into the cycle of worrying about what people think, fearing rejection, or feeling pressure to meet expectations.

	But Jesus came to set you free from the fear of man and to establish you in your true identityâ€”loved, chosen, and fully accepted by Him.

	The fear of man is a snare because it keeps you trapped. It makes you hesitate instead of walking boldly in your calling. It keeps you silent when God is calling you to speak. It causes you to shrink back when you were meant to stand firm. But Jesus never called you to live in fearâ€”He called you to live in His love and confidence.

	The moment you said yes to Jesus, everything changed. You became a new creation (2 Corinthians 5:17). You are not defined by peopleâ€™s opinions. You are defined by Godâ€™s truth. And His truth says:

	You are loved unconditionally. (Romans 8:38-39)

	You are fully accepted in Christ. (Ephesians 1:6)

	You are chosen and set apart. (1 Peter 2:9)

	You are fearfully and wonderfully made. (Psalm 139:14)

	When you truly understand how much Jesus loves you, fear loses its power. His love removes the need to strive for approval. His grace silences the voice of insecurity. You no longer have to seek validation from peopleâ€”because you already have it from God.

	The second half of Proverbs 29:25 says, â€œWhoever trusts in the Lord shall be safe.â€ This means that your security is not in people, but in God. When you trust Him, you are standing on a foundation that cannot be shaken. Even if people reject you, criticize you, or misunderstand you, Jesus remains constant. His love for you never changes.

	Today, let go of the fear of man. You donâ€™t have to impress anyone. You donâ€™t have to prove yourself. You are already enough in Christ. Walk boldly in the identity He has given you, knowing that you are safe in His hands.

	Jesus, I declare that I am free from the fear of man. I do not live for the approval of othersâ€”I live for You. Your love is my security, and Your grace is my confidence. I reject every lie that says I am not enough, and I choose to believe the truth that I am fully accepted in You. I trust You completely, and I will walk boldly in my identity as Your beloved. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: Fear of man will prove to be a snare, but whoever trusts in the LORD is kept safe. - Proverbs 29:25

devotionals.title: Joy Unending in My Presence
devotionals.devotionalText:
Jesus spoke these words to His disciples before His crucifixion, knowing they would soon experience sorrow and confusion. But He also gave them a promiseâ€”a joy that no one could take away. And this promise is for you today.

	Life brings challenges, pain, and unexpected struggles. But no matter what happens, Jesusâ€™s love secures your joy. His love is not fragile, and neither is the joy He gives. It is not based on circumstancesâ€”it is rooted in the unshakable truth of who He is and who you are in Him.

	Before Jesus, your identity may have been tied to your past, your failures, or the opinions of others. But now, in Christ, you are a new creation (2 Corinthians 5:17). You are not defined by what happens to youâ€”you are defined by what Jesus has done for you. His grace has given you a joy that is not temporary, but eternal.

	The world offers happiness that fades. It depends on things going right, on achievements, on people treating you well. But the joy of the Lord is differentâ€”it is supernatural. It is joy that stands strong in the face of adversity. It is joy that keeps your heart at peace even when storms come. It is the joy of knowing you are deeply loved, fully forgiven, and forever secure in Jesus.

	The enemy will try to steal your joy. He will whisper lies that say, 'You're not enough,' 'Things will never change,' 'God has forgotten you.' But Jesus speaks a greater truth:

	You are fully known and fully loved. (Jeremiah 31:3)

	You are chosen and set apart. (Ephesians 1:4)

	You are victorious in Him. (Romans 8:37)

	You have a joy that cannot be taken away. (John 16:22)

	Even in seasons of sorrow, His love sustains you. Even when life shakes you, His joy remains. No oneâ€”not people, not circumstances, not even the enemyâ€”can take away what Jesus has given you.

	Today, renew your mind with this truth: Your joy is secure in Jesus. Choose to walk in it, to embrace it, and to live from the place of confidence in His love.

	Jesus, I thank You that my joy is found in You, not in my circumstances. No one can take away the joy You have given me. I reject every lie that tells me otherwise, and I stand firm in the truth that I am loved, chosen, and secure in You. Even in difficult times, I will rejoice because Your grace sustains me. I walk in unshakable joy today and always. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: Therefore you now have sorrow; but I will see you again and your heart will rejoice, and your joy no one will take from you. - John 16:22

devotionals.title: Everlasting Constancy in a Shifting World
devotionals.devotionalText:
One of the most powerful truths you can hold onto is this: Jesus never changes. His love for you remains constant. His grace never runs out. His promises are always true. In a world that shifts, disappoints, and changes, Jesus is your unshakable foundation.

	Life can be unpredictable. People change. Circumstances change. Your emotions can rise and fall. But in the midst of it all, Jesus is steady, unmovable, and faithful. The same Jesus who healed the sick, calmed the storm, and forgave sins in the Bible is the same Jesus who loves you today.

	Sometimes, the enemy tries to make you question God's love when things donâ€™t go as planned. Thoughts like 'Has God changed? Is He still for me? Does He still love me?' may try to creep into your mind. But Hebrews 13:8 is a firm reminder that Jesus has not changed His mind about you.

	The same Jesus who called you is still leading you.

	The same Jesus who saved you is still holding you.

	The same Jesus who forgave you is still covering you in grace.

	The same Jesus who promised never to leave you is still by your side.

	Your identity in Christ is secure because His love never changes. You are still chosen (Ephesians 1:4), redeemed (Colossians 1:14), and victorious (Romans 8:37). His love for you is not based on your performanceâ€”it is based on who He is.

	The world may tell you that love fades, that people walk away, and that nothing lasts forever. But Jesus proves otherwise. His love is eternal. His commitment to you is unwavering. When you build your life on Him, you are standing on a foundation that cannot be shaken.

	If youâ€™ve been feeling uncertain, struggling with fear, or battling thoughts that make you doubt your worth, fix your mind on this truth: Jesus is the same yesterday, today, and forever. His love for you is as strong today as it was on the cross. He has not and will not change His mind about you.

	Jesus, I thank You that You never change. Your love for me is constant, and Your grace is always enough. I refuse to believe the lie that You have forgotten me or changed Your mind about me. I stand firm in my identity as Your beloved. No matter what happens around me, I will trust in Your unshakable love. I walk in peace, confidence, and joy because I am secure in You. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever. - Hebrews 13:8

devotionals.title: Returning to Your First Love
devotionals.devotionalText:
Jesusâ€™s words to the church in Ephesus are both sobering and loving. He wasnâ€™t condemning themâ€”He was calling them back. They were doing good works, standing strong in faith, and rejecting evil, yet their hearts had drifted. They had left their first love, not lost it.

	This verse isnâ€™t just about the Ephesian churchâ€”itâ€™s about all of us. Life gets busy. Distractions pull at our attention. Our hearts can slowly drift away from the intimacy we once had with Jesus. But hereâ€™s the beautiful truth: Jesus never left. His love has remained constant, patiently calling us back into a place of closeness with Him.

	Maybe you remember a time when your heart burned with passion for Jesusâ€”when His presence was your greatest joy, when worship felt personal, and when prayer was more than a routine. But now, maybe your faith feels more like duty than delight. If so, know this: Jesus is not angryâ€”He is inviting you back to His heart.

	Your identity is not found in how much you do for God, but in how much you are loved by Him. You were never called to just work for Himâ€”you were called to be with Him. Jesusâ€™s love for you has not faded, and He longs for your heart to be fully alive in Him again.

	The enemy wants to fill your mind with guilt, telling you that youâ€™re too far gone, that your love for Jesus can never be restored. But grace says otherwise. His love is still as strong as ever, and He is waiting with open arms. You donâ€™t have to earn your way backâ€”just turn your heart toward Him.

	Renew your mind today with this truth: Jesus still loves you with the same intensity as the day He saved you. His love is not based on your performance, and He desires you more than anything you could ever do for Him.

	If your heart has drifted, He is calling you back. Not with condemnation, but with love. Not with pressure, but with grace. Return to your first love, because He has never stopped loving you.

	Jesus, I thank You that Your love for me has never changed. Even when my heart has drifted, You have remained faithful. I choose today to return to my first loveâ€”to seek You with all my heart, not out of obligation, but out of delight. Renew my passion for You. Let my love for You grow deeper every day. I am Yours, and nothing will separate me from Your love. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: Nevertheless I have this against you, that you have left your first love. - Revelation 2:4

devotionals.title: Delighting in Jesusâ€”Finding My True Fulfillment
devotionals.devotionalText:
Dear Beloved,

	To 'take delight in the LORD' is an invitation to immerse yourself in My love, to let the reality of My presence be the source of your greatest joy. It's about seeing the beauty in your relationship with Me, recognizing My hand in the little moments just as much as in the grand ones. It's in this place of deep connection and heartfelt delight that something miraculous happens: the desires of your heart begin to align with My own.

	My love for you is boundless, stretching further than the vast expanse of the skies. Within this love lies not only the promise of salvation but the promise of a life filled with meaning, purpose, and joy. My favor towards you is a tapestry woven with the threads of grace, provision, and unfailing guidance.

	When I say I will give you the desires of your heart, it's not merely about granting wishes like a genie in a bottle. It's about transforming your desires to reflect the beauty, purity, and love of My kingdom. It's about instilling in you dreams and aspirations that resonate with My plans for you, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.

	As you navigate the journey of your life, remember that in Me, you find more than just answers; you find fulfillment. In the delight of My presence, your heart's desires are shaped, nurtured, and brought to fruition. It's a divine dance of joy, where your heart and Mine beat as one, moving to the rhythm of eternal love.

	So, I invite you today, dear one, to find your delight in Me. Let the knowledge of My love and favor be the melody that guides your steps, the light that brightens your path, and the strength that empowers your journey. In the embrace of My love, you'll discover not only the fulfillment of your desires but the very essence of life itself.

	With a love that satisfies your deepest longings, Jesus
devotionals.books: Delight yourself also in the Lord, and He shall give you the desires of your heart. - Psalm 37:4

devotionals.title: A Song in the Night
devotionals.devotionalText:
David wrote these words during a time of great distress. He was being hunted by enemies, surrounded by danger, and had every reason to be afraid. Yet, instead of focusing on the threats around him, he made a choiceâ€”to sing of Godâ€™s power, to declare His love, and to trust in His refuge.

	This is the revelation Jesus wants you to have today: You are not defenseless. You are not weak. You are not alone. No matter what challenges you face, Jesus is your strength, your refuge, and your defender. His love surrounds you like a shield, and His grace is the foundation of your identity.

	Sometimes, the enemy tries to make you feel vulnerableâ€”like you have to fight battles on your own. He whispers lies that say youâ€™re not strong enough, that youâ€™re not protected, that things wonâ€™t change. But Jesus has already won the victory for you. You donâ€™t have to fight in your own strengthâ€”you stand in His strength.

	David didnâ€™t wait until the battle was over to praise Godâ€”he sang in the middle of the storm. This is the power of renewing your mind. When you shift your focus from fear to faith, from problems to promises, from struggles to Jesus, your heart is strengthened in His love.

	You are not just a person struggling through lifeâ€”you are a child of God, chosen and protected. His mercy covers you, His power sustains you, and His presence surrounds you. Your identity is not in your past mistakes, your current struggles, or what others say about you. Your identity is in Christâ€”loved, secure, victorious.

	So today, make the choice to sing of His love. Not because everything is perfect, but because Jesus is perfect. Sing of His mercy, not because you have it all figured out, but because His grace is enough.

	No attack, no fear, no situation can shake the truth that Jesus is your refuge and your strength. He is your defender. And His love for you will never fail.

	Jesus, I choose to sing of Your love and power. No matter what I face, I declare that You are my refuge, my strength, and my defender. I am not afraid because I know You are with me. Your love surrounds me, and Your mercy sustains me. I stand in my identity as Your childâ€”safe, strong, and victorious. Today, I renew my mind with Your truth and walk in the confidence of Your unfailing love. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: But I will sing of your strength, in the morning I will sing of your love; for you are my fortress, my refuge in times of trouble. You are my strength, I sing praise to you; you, God, are my fortress, my God on whom I can rely. - Psalm 59:16-17

devotionals.title: Empowered by Endless Love
devotionals.devotionalText:
This verse is one of the most powerful declarations in the Bible. But itâ€™s more than just a motivational statementâ€”itâ€™s a revelation of identity, dependence on Jesus, and the supernatural strength His love provides.

	Paul wrote these words while in prison, facing hardship, yet he was filled with confidence. Why? Because his strength wasnâ€™t based on his own abilityâ€”it was rooted in Jesus. His circumstances didnâ€™t define his faithâ€”his faith defined his circumstances.

	The moment you received Jesus, you stepped into a new identity. You are no longer weak, defeated, or lacking. You are strong in Him. His love has filled you, His grace has covered you, and His power now works through you.

	The enemy will try to convince you that youâ€™re not enoughâ€”that you donâ€™t have what it takes, that youâ€™re too broken, too unworthy, or too weak. But Jesusâ€™s love proves otherwise. His strength isnâ€™t given to those who have it all togetherâ€”itâ€™s given to those who trust in Him.

	This verse doesnâ€™t mean that life will be easy or that you wonâ€™t face challenges. But it means that whatever comes your way, you have access to supernatural strength through Jesus. You donâ€™t have to rely on your own abilitiesâ€”His grace is your power.

	Walking in the truth of Philippians 4:13 starts with renewing your mind. Instead of thinking, 'I canâ€™t do this,' start declaring, 'Through Christ, I can!' Instead of believing, 'I am weak,' declare, 'Jesus is my strength!'

	When you face struggles, donâ€™t let fear or doubt control your thoughts. Shift your focus to Jesus. His love for you is unshakable, and His power is more than enough to carry you through anything.

	You are not defined by your limitationsâ€”you are defined by His limitless grace. No matter what today holds, you can stand in confidence knowing that Jesus is strengthening you.

	Jesus, I thank You that I am not limited by my own strength. Through You, I can do all things. I reject the lies that say I am weak, unworthy, or incapable, and I embrace the truth that I am empowered by Your love. devotionals.books: I can do all this through him who gives me strength. - Philippians 4:13

devotionals.title: The Unfailing Source of Strength
devotionals.devotionalText:
Life is full of pressures, worries, and burdens that can weigh us down. But Jesus never intended for you to carry them alone. His love for you is so deep, so personal, that He invites you to cast every care upon Him. He is not distant or indifferentâ€”He cares for you.

	Sometimes, we hold onto our worries, thinking we have to figure everything out. We stress over the future, replay past failures, or feel overwhelmed by situations we cannot control. But Jesus lovingly says, 'Give it to Me.' He doesnâ€™t just want to help you carry the weightâ€”He wants to take it completely.

	The moment you accepted Jesus, you were made new (2 Corinthians 5:17). You are no longer a person who has to live under the weight of anxiety, fear, or stress. You are now a child of God, deeply loved, and fully cared for.

	Your identity is not in your strugglesâ€”itâ€™s in Christ. And because of that, you have the right to release every burden into His hands.

	You are not aloneâ€”Jesus is with you.

	You are not powerlessâ€”He is your strength.

	You are not forgottenâ€”His love covers you.

	The enemy wants you to believe that you have to figure everything out on your own. But Jesus already knows every detail of your life, and He has already made a way for you. His love is your security, and His grace is more than enough.

	Giving your worries to Jesus is not just a one-time actionâ€”itâ€™s a mindset shift. Every time worry tries to creep in, remind yourself: 'I am loved. I am held. I am cared for.'

	When anxious thoughts come, donâ€™t hold onto themâ€”release them. Speak this truth over yourself:

	'Jesus loves me too much to let me carry this alone.'

	'My Father in heaven is taking care of me.'

	'I choose to rest in His peace, not my own strength.'

	Today, make a choice to cast your cares upon Him. You are not meant to carry burdensâ€”you are meant to walk in His peace. His love is strong enough to hold you, and His grace is more than enough to sustain you.

	Jesus, I thank You that You care for me deeply. I release every worry, every fear, and every burden into Your hands. I refuse to carry what You have already promised to take. I trust in Your love, knowing that You are my provider, protector, and peace. I am not defined by anxietyâ€”I am defined by Your love. I walk in freedom today, knowing that You are always with me. devotionals.books: Casting all your care upon Him, for He cares for you. - 1 Peter 5:7

devotionals.title: Great plans for you
devotionals.devotionalText:
Bartimaeus was a blind beggar, sitting on the roadside, unnoticed by most but not by Jesus. His condition defined his lifeâ€”blind, dependent on others, rejected by society. But on this day, everything was about to change.

	This story isnâ€™t just about Bartimaeusâ€”itâ€™s about you and me. At some point, weâ€™ve all been in a place where we felt overlooked, stuck, or defined by our struggles. Maybe youâ€™ve carried labelsâ€”broken, unworthy, not good enough. But the love of Jesus sees beyond all that. He doesnâ€™t define you by your past, your struggles, or what people say about you. He defines you by His love and grace.

	Bartimaeus had spent years begging for scraps, just trying to survive. But when he heard that Jesus was near, hope awakened. He called out, 'Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!' (Mark 10:47). The crowd tried to silence him, but he refused to let anything stop him from encountering Jesus.

	Maybe youâ€™ve felt like thatâ€”like life, circumstances, or even your own doubts try to silence you. But hereâ€™s the truth: Jesus is calling you. His love is bigger than your past, stronger than your fears, and greater than any obstacle in your way.

	And when Jesus called Bartimaeus forward, something powerful happenedâ€”he threw aside his cloak (Mark 10:50). That cloak represented his old identityâ€”his label as a beggar, his past, his limitations. He let it go because he knew he wasnâ€™t going to need it anymore.

	What do you need to throw aside today? Doubt? Fear? The need for approval? The weight of past mistakes? Whatever it is, let it go. Jesus is here, calling you into His freedom.

	Bartimaeus didnâ€™t stay by the roadsideâ€”he followed Jesus. And today, you can do the same.

	Jesus, I thank You that I am no longer defined by my past or my struggles. You see me, You love me, and You are calling me into something greater. I throw aside every label, every doubt, and every fear that has held me back. My identity is in Youâ€”I am chosen, I am loved, I am free. I follow You with confidence, knowing that Your love has made me whole. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: Now they came to Jericho. As He went out of Jericho with His disciples and a great multitude, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the road begging. - Mark 10:46

devotionals.title: Refusing to Be Silencedâ€”Jesus Hears Me
devotionals.devotionalText:
Bartimaeus was blind, sitting on the roadside, calling out to Jesus. But as soon as he began to cry out, the crowd tried to silence him. They told him to be quiet, to stay in his place, to stop reaching for something greater. But he refused. Instead of backing down, he cried out even louder.

	The enemy always tries to silence those who are stepping into their identity in Christ. He whispers, â€œYouâ€™re not worthy. Youâ€™re not good enough. You donâ€™t deserve Godâ€™s attention.â€ But Jesus says otherwise. His love has already declared you worthy. His grace has already made you new.

	Bartimaeus had every reason to listen to the crowd. He was a beggar, considered unimportant by society. But deep inside, he knew something powerful: Jesus was his only hope. He didnâ€™t care what people thoughtâ€”he just wanted Jesus. And thatâ€™s what faith looks likeâ€”pursuing Jesus with boldness, knowing that His love is greater than anything that tries to hold you back.

	Maybe youâ€™ve been hesitant to go all in with Jesus. Maybe fear, shame, or past failures have tried to silence your faith. But today, Jesus is reminding you: Donâ€™t stop. Donâ€™t hold back. Keep calling out.

	Bartimaeus could have let the voices of the crowd shut him down, but instead, he chose faith over fear. And Jesus heard him.

	The same is true for you. When you call on Jesus, He hears you. He sees you. He stops for you. His love is unshakable, and His grace empowers you to rise above every lie that says youâ€™re not enough.

	The world may try to silence you, but Jesus hears you.

	Fear may try to stop you, but His love gives you boldness.

	Doubt may creep in, but His Word is your truth.

	Today, let go of every voice that says you canâ€™t, and stand firm in the truth that Jesus is near, and Heâ€™s calling you forward.

	Jesus, I refuse to be silenced by fear, doubt, or the opinions of others. I know that You hear me, and I choose to call out to You in faith. I let go of every lie that says Iâ€™m not enough, and I stand in the truth that I am loved, chosen, and worthy in Your eyes. No matter what comes against me, I will pursue You with boldness, knowing that You have called me forward. Amen! âœï¸
devotionals.books: Then many warned him to be quiet; but he cried out all the more, â€˜Son of David, have mercy on me!â€™ - Mark 10:48

devotionals.title: Throwing Off the Oldâ€”Stepping Into My New Identity
devotionals.devotionalText:
This one small action speaks volumes about faith, identity, and transformation. Bartimaeus had been a blind beggar for years, and his garment represented his old lifeâ€”his struggle, his limitations, and the identity the world had given him. But when Jesus called him forward, he didnâ€™t hesitate. He threw off the old and stepped into something new.

	This is exactly what Jesus calls you to do. His love doesnâ€™t just heal youâ€”it transforms you. The moment He calls your name, everything changes. You are no longer defined by your past. You are no longer bound by what once held you back. You have been given a new identity in Christ.
